img.alt: US News Best High Schools Silver 2018

article.title: Congratulations to our Teacher and Support Staff of the Year finalists

tr.td: Congratulations to our Teacher and Support Staff of the Year finalists

div.font: Despite working from home, our Teacher and Support Staff of the Year committees have continued their work of selecting finalists for this year’s honors. The virtual surprise announcements were recorded in order to share the exciting news.

article.title: Board approves selection of new activities director

tr.td: Board approves selection of new activities director

div.font: The Pattonville Board of Education on April 14 approved the selection of Jason Sellers as activities director of Pattonville High School. Sellers will begin his new role on July 1.

article.title: Board sets last day of school for 2019-2020 school year

tr.td: Board sets last day of school for 2019-2020 school year

div.font: The Pattonville Board of Education on April 14 approved setting the last day of school for this year as May 29 for students in early childhood through 11th grade. The last day for seniors is May 15.

article.title: Notes from the April 14 board meeting

tr.td: Notes from the April 14 board meeting

div.font: Read about actions taken at the recent school board meeting. Find out more by visiting Pattonville's

article.title: Pattonville alumnae that earned CNA certification in high school now working front lines against COVID-19

tr.td: Pattonville alumnae that earned CNA certification in high school now working front lines against COVID-19

div.font: Several Pattonville High School seniors have earned certification as a Certified Nurse Assistant (CNA) after completing their CNA training at Pattonville and passing the state certification exam. Over the years, many have continued working in the health and medical fields furthering their education in order to help others.

"All of these students are PHS grads who completed their CNA training at PHS and are fighting the good fight right now,” health science teacher Ms. Anjie Stendeback said. “I could not be more proud of the work that these kids, former students, professionals are doing right now.”

article.title: Pattonville Board of Education meeting on April 14 will be virtual

tr.td: Pattonville Board of Education meeting on April 14 will be virtual

div.font: The April 14 Pattonville Board of Education will take place virtually to ensure the safety of our community, board and staff. To watch the open meeting live, please visit the following link:

, and if prompted, use the following password: 3uv0nu. Upon logging in, you will be placed in a waiting room until the meeting starts at 7 p.m. Upon joining the meeting, you will be able to view the meeting, but your audio and video will be muted. Meetings will be broadcast live electronically while the district is closed due to COVID-19.

To submit a comment for the public participation portion of the meeting, email Kelly Gordon, community relations specialist and secretary to the board of education, at kgordon@psdr3.org before 6:30 p.m. on Tuesday, April 14. Please include your name, relation to Pattonville, phone number, email address and message as you would like it to be read. Please limit messages to 200 words. Comments will be read by the board during the public participation portion of the event (agenda item 2.02). Messages received after 6:30 p.m. will be read during the May 12 board meeting. Please note, any statements submitted and read during the meeting are considered public records under the Sunshine Law.
